publicationStmt.p: Distributed by Digital Scholarship Services at Lafayette College

lg.l: A man wtḥ expence & wonderfull toil
By Planting & Dunging enobled his Soil
There fruits of yẹ best yẹ tast did invite
And uniform ordṛ Still courted yẹ Sight
No degenerate Weed yẹ rich ground did produce
But all things afforded for beauty & use
Till from Dunghill transplanted while yet but a Seed
A Nettle raisḍ up his inglorious head
The Gardnṛ wou'ḍ Wisely have rooted him up
To Stop yẹ increase of A barbarous crop
But yẹ Mastṛ forbad him & aftṛ yẹ fashion
Of Foolish good nature & blind moderation
Forbid him thro' pitty & chooseth much rather
To ask him some questions first how hee came thither
Kind Sṛ quoth yẹ Nettle a Stranger I caome
By conscience compellḍ to relinquish my home
'cause I wouḍ not Subscribe to a mistery dark
That yẹ Prince of all Tree's was yẹ Iesuits bark
An Erroneous tenet I know Sṛ yṭ you
(that know more than my Self) will allow to be true
Theres none so renownḍ for compassion as you
And tho' in Some things I may differ from these
The rest of yṛ faithfull & beautifull Tree's.
Tho' by digging & Dunging my nature much harm'd
And I cannot comply wth. yoṛ Gardnṛ in form
Yet I & our Family, after our fashion
Will peaceably stick to our own Education
Be pleasḍ to allow us a place for to rest in
'Mongst yẹ rest of yẹ tree's wee'l nevṛ molest 'em
Kind Shelter to us (& protection) afford
Wee'l do you no harm i'le giue you my word
Th' good man was Soon won by this plausible tale
(So fraud on good nature does often prevail)
Hee welcomes his guest giues him free tolleration
In yee
midst of his Garden to take up his Station
And into his bosom does his enemy bring
Hee nevṛ Suspected yẹ Nettle would sting
Till flush't wth
Success, of Strength to be feard
Around him a numerous offspring hee rear'd
Then yẹ Mastṛ grew Sencible what hee had done
And fain wou'ḍ have had his new quest to be gone
But now t'was too late to bid 'em turn out
Well rooted possession already was got
The old Tree's decayḍ & in their room grew
A Stubborn, Rank, pestilent poys'nous crew
The Mastṛ who first yṭ young brood had admitted
They Stung like ingrates & left him unpittyed
No help from Man'ring & planting was found
The Weed had eat out yẹ heart of yẹ ground
Thus one Nettle uncropt increa'st to Such Store
There was nothing but Weeds what was Garden beforeX85-742O
